javax.jaxtx
Interface UserTransaction

All Known Subinterfaces:
Atom, Cohesion
public interface UserTransaction

The transaction interface is split into two: (i) the client component, which is typically only interested in starting and ending a transaction session. (ii) the participant component, which is typically only interested in registering a participant with the transaction. The UserTransaction is the interface that most users (e.g., clients and services) will see. This isolates them from any underlying protocol specific aspects of the implementation they are using. If required, an underlying implementation may enhance this interface and provide additional methods to users. It is envisioned that users will cast to the underlying implementation or use reflection. It is expected that UserTransactions will be made available via JNDI and that there should be the possibility for a user to locate all possible transaction implementations to determine which one it requires.

Method Detail

configuration

public org.w3c.dom.Document configuration()
                                   throws SystemException
Returns parse-able information about the protocol this transaction implements.
Returns:
the XML configuration document.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if an error occurs.

start

public void start(int timeout)
           throws WrongStateException,
                  NestingNotAllowedException,
                  InvalidTimeoutException,
                  SystemException
Start a new transaction activity and associate it with the current thread. The timeout parameter is used to terminate the transaction after a specified period if it has not already begun to terminate. If a transaction is already associated with the current thread and the transaction implementation does not support nesting, then the NestingNotAllowedException is thrown.
Parameters:
int - timeout The timeout (in seconds) to associate with all subsequently created transactions. This value must be 0 or greater.
Throws:
WrongStateException - Thrown if there is a transaction already associated with the invoking thread and it is in a state that does not allow a sibling transaction to be created.
NestingNotAllowedException - Thrown if there is a transaction already associated with the invoking thread and nested transactions are not supported.
InvalidTimeoutException - Thrown if the timeout value is invalid within the scope of this transaction implementation. For example, so implementations may not support timeouts at all.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurs.

end

public Outcome end()
            throws NoTransactionException,
                   InvalidTransactionException,
                   WrongStateException,
                   NoPermissionException,
                   ProtocolViolationException,
                   SystemException
End the transaction in the current completion status. If no completion status has been set for the transaction, then the default status of CompletionStatusCancel is used.
Returns:
the result of terminating the transaction. This may be null and in which case it implies that the transaction terminated successfully in the compeletion status required.
Throws:
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the transaction is invalid in the current execution environment.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the current transaction is not in a state that allows it to end, or end in the required completion state. For example, it is already terminating on behalf of a different thread.
NoPermissionException - Thrown if the invoking thread does not have permission to terminate the transaction.
ProtocolViolationException - Thrown if an error occurs which violates the normal termination of the protocol. For example, a heuristic outcome from a two-phase commit protocol would fall into this category.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurs.

end

public Outcome end(CompletionStatus endStatus)
            throws NoTransactionException,
                   InvalidTransactionException,
                   WrongStateException,
                   ProtocolViolationException,
                   NoPermissionException,
                   SystemException
End the transaction in the specified completion status. If the completion status is null then the last completion status set for this transaction is used, or CompletionStatusCancel.
Parameters:
CompletionStatus - endStatus The completion status that the transaction should attempt to terminate in.
Returns:
the result of terminating the transaction. This may be null and in which case it implies that the transaction terminated successfully in the compeletion status required.
Throws:
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the transaction is invalid in the current execution environment.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the current transaction is not in a state that allows it to end, or end in the required completion state. For example, it is already terminating on behalf of a different thread.
NoPermissionException - Thrown if the invoking thread does not have permission to terminate the transaction.
ProtocolViolationException - Thrown if an error occurs which violates the normal termination of the protocol. For example, a heuristic outcome from a two-phase commit protocol would fall into this category.
SystemException - Thrown if some other error occurs.

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(int timeout)
                throws InvalidTimeoutException,
                       SystemException
Set the timeout to be associated with all subsequently created transactions. A default value of 0 is automatically associated with each thread and this means that no application specified timeout is set for transactions.
Parameters:
int - timeout The timeout (in seconds) to associate with all subsequently created transactions. This value must be 0 or greater.
Throws:
InvalidTimeoutException - Thrown if the timeout value provided is negative, too large, or if timeouts are simply not supported by the transaction implementation.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

getTimeout

public int getTimeout()
               throws SystemException
Get the timeout value currently associated with transactions.
Returns:
the timeout value in seconds, or 0 if no application specified timeout has been provided.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.

setCompletionStatus

public void setCompletionStatus(CompletionStatus endStatus)
                         throws NoTransactionException,
                                WrongStateException,
                                SystemException
Set the termination status for the current transaction, if any.
Parameters:
CompletionStatus - endStatus The state in which the transaction coordinator should attempt to terminate the transaction. This may be one of the default values provided by JAXTX or may be extended in an implementation specific manner.
Throws:
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the completion status is incompatible with the current state of the transaction.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

getCompletionStatus

public CompletionStatus getCompletionStatus()
                                     throws NoTransactionException,
                                            SystemException
Get the completion status currently associated with the transaction.
Returns:
the termination status for the current transaction, if any.
Throws:
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the current thread.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

getTransactionContext

public TxContext getTransactionContext()
                                throws SystemException
Get an opaque representation of the current transaction hierarchy.
Returns:
the token representing the current context, if any, and null otherwise.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.

suspend

public TxContext suspend()
                  throws SystemException
Suspend the current transaction from this thread and return the token representing the context, if any, and null otherwise. Once called, the thread will have no transaction associated with it.
Returns:
the token representing the current context, if any, and null otherwise.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.

resume

public void resume(TxContext tx)
            throws InvalidTransactionException,
                   SystemException
Given a token representing a context, associate it with the current thread of control. This will implicitly disassociate the thread from any transaction that it may already be associated with. If the parameter is null then the thread is associated with no transaction.
Parameters:
TxContext - tx The transaction to associate with this thread. This may be null in which case the current thread becomes associated with no transaction.
Throws:
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the transaction handle is invalid in this context.
SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

status

public Status status()
              throws SystemException
Returns:
the status of the current transaction, if any.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.

globalIdentity

public java.lang.String globalIdentity()
                                throws SystemException
Returns:
the transaction identity. If there is no transaction associated with the thread, then null is returned. In order that transaction ids are guaranteed to be unique across different models, the identity is required to be prefixed with the package name, e.g., "javax.jaxtx.model.jta.1234".
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.

transactionName

public java.lang.String transactionName()
                                 throws SystemException
Typically used for debugging purposes.
Returns:
a user-friendly name for this transaction. If there is no transaction associated with the current thread, then null is returned. This value may be the same as that returned by globalIdentity.
Throws:
SystemException - Thrown if any error occurs.
